page.title: 06Newcastle; Ouseburn Devel.
page.content: The Ouseburn flows South through a deep{dene}to reach the Tyne East of Newcastle. In the north picturesque {Jesmond Dene}is a pleasant contrast to city life with bridges, walks, waterfalls, historic buildings and a restaurant. Children enjoy Pets' Corner and picnic and play on the open spaces. The{Sunday Market}on the {Armstrong Bridge}industrial monument is an outlet for local artists and craft goods. Below the Bridge the Dene changes character with a proposed flyover on an area of allotments and pigeon{crees followed by redeveloped pottery works and a newly landscaped area for starter factories beneath the graceful concrete metro viaduct. Beyond the {Byker city farm}a small basin off the Tyne, overlooked by warehouses, is used by a mixture of small boats.
